reviews.text: Ms. Janssen is a sweetheart, she’s literally so nice and you have fun in her lessons, best part is doing the chawon bowls. Her finals aren’t that hard either, she gives you a maximum grade for your effort.

I loved having Mrs. Janssen as my art teacher. She was extremely supportive to everyone and taught different art styles and painting techniques. but i also felt she was favored students that were natural artists and would pick their work to display in the art wing. Unfortunately for my friend, had to work hard just to get an B in her class because Mrs. Janssen wasn't fond of her messy art technique.Submitted by a student

She's such a nice and knowledgeable teacher, and I would really want to take her again, but being the Lowell student that I am, I have to worry more about grades. As friendly as she is, she is quite stingy with those A's. Many people get B's.

Had her for Ceramics. She's a really nice teacher that actually wants you to learn about art. She goes over your piece with you and gives you ideas/suggestions. She also has days where everyone just walks around and comments on other people's pieces. You can talk in class and listen to mp3s. Easy A
if all lowell teachers were like ms. janssen, lowell would be like HEAVEN. i am serious when i say this. she's totally just awesome!

Literally the best teacher I ever had in my life. One of the most genuine and caring people if you get to know her. I would highly recommend her to anybody and encourage that you take a class from her. So thankful to have her at Lowell.
awesome ceramics teacher but do not take her 6-7 b/c it won't be her. it's her student teacher. differs every year. good luck

she is one of the nicest teachers at lowell. she is very optimistic. if ur project blows up in the kiln she still makes u feel like its a masterpiece, however, her grades do not reflect that. even though its a ceramics class, it is hard to get an A. she isnt very lenient and deducts points for stupid reasons.
I LOVE MS. JANSSEN. She's easy, helpful, fun and really really nice. If you wanna do art, TAKE HER. She's the best, I'm telling you.
The coolest reg. teacher(: She's always willing to help anyone, she smiles constantly, she gives advice.
She's really nice, but I was surprised that she is stubborn with As. Most people got Bs in her class. If school is all about grades to you, avoid her. She's good at giving suggestions though.
nice, but takes ceramics WAYYY too seriously. we all kow it should be an easy A, and its not. I show up everyday and do my work. while i am not talented AT ALL, i should get an A for effort!
Janssen is the coolest and nicest teacher in all of Lowell. A lot o fun in her classes.

MS. JANSSEN IS AWESOME. She always gives help if you need it. When your proj goes wrong in some way, she will help you think of a way to fix it if you have some kind of idea too. She is very nice. She's fair and doesn't give bad grades w/o a reason. She likes creativity and EFFORT
Grades on effort (a little will do). Enough said.

I took Ms. Janssen for about two and a half years in high school. Ceramics became one of my favorite classes right away. I never found her to be stingy with A's, but she does like to make you think outside of the box. And I feel that she grades on effort and creativity, not as much as the actual piece of work. I took one semester with the other teacher, and no way does she compare to Ms. Janssen. Overall, she is a wonderful teacher and very talented as well.
i learned a lot about ceramics from her class. she gives almost everyone an A, just as long as you make the projects. she's nice and i've never seen her not smiling.
Mrs. Janssen is really cool. She's the best Reg teacher!!!
awesome teacher! she knows what she's doing because she's an artist herself and she will occasionally show you her creations, which are great!
this is 1 of my best classes n i alway look forward to it cos mrs janssen is sooo cool
yay! easy A, fun to talk to, can be late to class, helpful.
She is the nicest person at Lowell. Always ready to go out of her way to help you. Ms. Janssen is the BEST REG TEACHER EVER!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
ms. janssen's an awesome teacher. easy A, fun class

Ms. janssen is probably the nicest teacher at lowell and is very generous with grades. She is extremely helpful and does watever she can to make your project better. she taught me to love art and even if u arent that good if u show that u try and that you r work she will give you an a regaurdless of talent

Ms. Janssen is one of the nicest teacher at Lowell. Extremely helpful and tells you exactly what needs to be done on your piece of work. Just don't slack off and take time outside class to finish your piece if you're not done and you'll get an A :)

Ms. Janssen is one of my favorite teachers at Lowell. She is super caring and supportive, and is willing to get to know every student. She's also really accepting about different art styles. The class itself was really chill, you basically work on whatever project she wants you to do. Pretty easy grader, especially if you put forth a lot of effort, don't know anyone with a grade below a B.Submitted by a student
very nice and pretty easy, helps you alot if u are stuck..never mad..nicest teacher at lowell

Ms. Janssen is very friendly, always comes in with a smile at the beginning of class. Class is pretty easy, you can listen to music and relax. It's a good idea to ask her to go over a piece, just to see what she expects or get her advice on it.

ok, overall. Easy B but doens't give too many A's, has deadlines that may be hard if you dont know what you're doing. Not hard b/c its not an academic class. no HW, of course. and thats probably all you need to really know if you're considering a class with her. She's nice and friendly, too.

I loved Ms.janssen's class. Although she gives B's, put some effort into your work (as in, use class time to work on your pieces, rather than slacking off), and it becomes an easy A. Will help you with any questions, and it was a fun class overall.
